txt.en: You have solved the Riddle of the Serpent. There is another plaque on the east wall of this room
Falgeirr Twisttongue, a dwarf with a penchant for riddles, left messages throughout Moria for those with the key to solving his strange runes and twisting words. You have just such a key.

You have found a plaque bearing the strange runes of Falgeirr Twisttongue, author of the papers you found in Katûb-zahar. When translated, they read as follows:

I can sizzle like bacon; I am made with an egg,
I have plenty of backbone, but lack a good leg,
I peel layers like onions, but still remain whole,
I can be long, like a flag-pole, yet fit in small holes.
What am I?

You should try and solve Falgeirr Twisttongue's riddle:

I can sizzle like bacon; I am made with an egg,
I have plenty of backbone, but lack a good leg,
I peel layers like onions, but still remain whole,
I can be long, like a flag-pole, yet fit in small holes.
What am I?

The solution to the riddle can be found somewhere in the Silvertine Lodes.

'You discovered the answer to the riddle upon a plaque left by Falgeirr? It was a snake? Of course! How could I have missed it!\n\n'I've seen these plaques you describe in many places throughout Khazad-dûm, yet I had no idea they were related to these riddles!'
Öndótt can be found in the Deep Descent, south of the Great Delving.\n\nTell Öndótt that you have discovered the solution to Falgeirr's riddle!

'Have you noticed these old plaques? Quite interesting, historically speaking. I've seen them in several parts of Khazad-dûm. They were used to help name places -- the Skull Room, Horse Hall, that sort of thing -- and usually placed over doorways.\n\n'What? The riddle? I have no idea.'
Talk to Öndótt at the Deep Descent encampment
A Riddle in an Old City
